en: When he gave his promise to his father, he meditated within himself to increase the fortunes of his sisters by the present of a thousand pounds a‚Äìpiece. He then really thought himself equal to it. The prospect of four thousand a‚Äìyear, in addition to his present income, besides the remaining half of his own mother's fortune, warmed his heart, and made him feel capable of generosity.‚Äî "Yes, he would give them three thousand pounds: it would be liberal and handsome! It would be enough to make them completely easy. Three thousand pounds! he could spare so considerable a sum with little inconvenience."‚Äî He thought of it all day long, and for many days successively, and he did not repent.

en: As a house, Barton Cottage, though small, was comfortable and compact; but as a cottage it was defective, for the building was regular, the roof was tiled, the window shutters were not painted green, nor were the walls covered with honeysuckles. A narrow passage led directly through the house into the garden behind. On each side of the entrance was a sitting room, about sixteen feet square; and beyond them were the offices and the stairs. Four bed‚Äìrooms and two garrets formed the rest of the house. It had not been built many years and was in good repair. In comparison of Norland, it was poor and small indeed!‚Äîbut the tears which recollection called forth as they entered the house were soon dried away. They were cheered by the joy of the servants on their arrival, and each for the sake of the others resolved to appear happy. It was very early in September; the season was fine, and from first seeing the place under the advantage of good weather, they received an impression in its favour which was of material service in recommending it to their lasting approbation.

es: Como vivienda, la casita de Barton, aunque peque√±a, era confortable y s√≥lida; pero en tanto casa de campo era defectuosa, porque la construcci√≥n era regular, el techo ten√≠a tejas, las celos√≠as de las ventanas no estaban pintadas de verde ni los muros estaban cubiertos de madreselva. Un corredor angosto llevaba directamente a trav√©s de la casa al jard√≠n del fondo. A ambos lados de la entrada hab√≠a una salita de estar de aproximadamente diecis√©is pies cuadrados; y luego estaban las dependencias de servicio y las escaleras. Cuatro dormitorios y dos buhardillas compon√≠an el resto de la casa. No hab√≠a sido construida hac√≠a muchos a√±os y estaba en buenas condiciones. En comparaci√≥n con Norland, ¬°ciertamente era peque√±a y pobre! Pero las l√°grimas que hicieron brotar los recuerdos al entrar a la casa muy pronto se secaron. Las alegr√≥ el gozo de los sirvientes a su llegada y cada una, pensando en las otras, decidi√≥ parecer contenta. Reci√©n comenzaba septiembre, el tiempo estaba hermoso, y desde la primera visi√≥n que tuvieron del lugar bajo las ventajas de un buen clima, la impresi√≥n favorable que recibieron fue de primordial importancia para que se hiciera acreedor de su m√°s firme aprobaci√≥n.

mg: Amin'ny maha-trano azy, i Barton Cottage, na dia kely aza, dia nahazo aina sy nalamina; Saingy toy ny trano bongo dia tsy nety ilay izy, satria tsy tapaka ilay trano, vita ny tafo, tsy nolokoina maitso ny varavarankely, ary tsy voarakotra tantely ny rindrina. Nisy lalana tery iray izay nitondra mivantana namakivaky ny trano ho any amin'ny zaridaina tao aoriana. Ary teo amin'ny lafiny roa amin'ny fidirana dia nisy efitra fandraisam-bahiny, tokony ho enina ambin'ny folo hakiho toradroa; Ary ankoatra azy ireo dia nisy ny birao sy ny tohatra. Efitra fandriana efatra sy miaramila roa no mandrafitra ny sisa amin'ny trano. Tsy naorina nandritra ny taona maro izy io ary efa namboarina tsara. Raha ampitahaina amin'i Norlandy, dia mahantra sy kely tokoa izany!‚Äîsaingy vetivety dia ritra ny ranomaso izay nahatsiaro rehefa niditra ny trano izy ireo. Faly er·ª≥ izy ireo rehefa tonga, ary samy tapa - kevitra ny ho sambatra izy ireo, noho ny amin'ny hafa. en: The situation of the house was good. High hills rose immediately behind, and at no great distance on each side; some of which were open downs, the others cultivated and woody. The village of Barton was chiefly on one of these hills, and formed a pleasant view from the cottage windows. The prospect in front was more extensive; it commanded the whole of the valley, and reached into the country beyond. The hills which surrounded the cottage terminated the valley in that direction; under another name, and in another course, it branched out again between two of the steepest of them.

en: "I do assure you," he replied, "that I have long thought on this point, as you think now. It has been, and is, and probably will always be a heavy misfortune to me, that I have had no necessary business to engage me, no profession to give me employment, or afford me any thing like independence. But unfortunately my own nicety, and the nicety of my friends, have made me what I am, an idle, helpless being. We never could agree in our choice of a profession. I always preferred the church, as I still do. But that was not smart enough for my family. They recommended the army. That was a great deal too smart for me. The law was allowed to be genteel enough; many young men, who had chambers in the Temple, made a very good appearance in the first circles, and drove about town in very knowing gigs. But I had no inclination for the law, even in this less abstruse study of it, which my family approved. As for the navy, it had fashion on its side, but I was too old when the subject was first started to enter it‚Äîand, at length, as there was no necessity for my having any profession at all, as I might be as dashing and expensive without a red coat on my back as with one, idleness was pronounced on the whole to be most advantageous and honourable, and a young man of eighteen is not in general so earnestly bent on being busy as to resist the solicitations of his friends to do nothing. I was therefore entered at Oxford and have been properly idle ever since."

es: ‚ÄîDe verdad le aseguro ‚Äîrespondi√≥ √©l‚Äî que he pensado mucho en este punto en el mismo sentido en que usted lo hace ahora. Ha sido, es y probablemente siempre ser√° una gran desgracia para m√≠ no haber tenido ninguna ocupaci√≥n a la cual obligatoriamente dedicarme, ninguna profesi√≥n que me d√© empleo o me ofrezca algo en la l√≠nea de la independencia. Pero, por desgracia, mi propia capacidad de comportarme de manera gentil, y la gentileza de mis amigos, han hecho de m√≠ lo que soy: un ser ocioso, incompetente. Nunca pudimos Ponemos de acuerdo en la elecci√≥n de una profesi√≥n. Yo siempre prefer√≠ la iglesia, como lo sigo haciendo. Pero eso no era bastante elegante para mi familia. Ellos recomendaban una carrera militar. Eso era demasiado, demasiado elegante para m√≠. En cuanto al ejercicio de las leyes, le concedieron la gracia de considerarla una profesi√≥n bastante decorosa; muchos j√≥venes con despachos en alguna Asociaci√≥n de Abogados de Londres han logrado una muy buena llegada a los c√≠rculos m√°s importantes, y se pasean por la ciudad conduciendo calesas muy a la moda. Pero yo no ten√≠a ninguna inclinaci√≥n por las leyes, ni siquiera en esta forma harto menos abstrusa de ellas que mi familia aprobaba. En cuanto a la marina, ten√≠a la ventaja de ser de buen tono, pero yo ya era demasiado mayor para ingresar a ella cuando se empez√≥ a hablar del tema; y, a la larga, como no hab√≠a verdadera necesidad de que tuviera una profesi√≥n, dado que pod√≠a ser igual de garboso y dispendioso con una chaqueta roja sobre los hombros o sin ella, se termin√≥ por decidir que el ocio era lo m√°s ventajoso y honorable; y a los dieciocho a√±os los j√≥venes por lo general no est√°n tan ansiosos de tener una ocupaci√≥n como para resistir las invitaciones de sus amigos a no hacer nada. Ingres√©, por tanto, a Oxford, y desde entonces he estado de ocioso, tal como hay que estar.

st: A araba, a re ho bona: "Ke a le bolella hore ke kgale ke nahana ka taba ena, jwalokaha le nahana hona jwale. E bile, 'me ke, 'me mohlomong e tla lula e le phoso e boima ho nna, hore ha ke na khoebo e hlokahalang ho kenella ho nna, ha ho mosebetsi oa ho mpha mosebetsi, kapa ho mpha ntho leha e le efe e kang boipuso. Empa ka bomalimabe, le molemo oa metsoalle ea ka, li entse hore ke seo ke leng sona, lefeela, le se nang thuso. Ha ho mohla re ka lumellanang le khetho ea rona ea mosebetsi. Kamehla ke ne ke rata kereke, joalo ka ha ke ntse ke e etsa. Empa sena se ne se sa lekana bakeng sa lelapa la ka. Ba khothalelitse sesole. O ne a le bohlale haholo ho nna. Molao o ne o lumelloa ho ba batho ba lekaneng; Bahlankana ba bangata, ba neng ba ena le dikamore ka Tempeleng, ba ile ba etsa ponahalo e ntle haholo mekolokong ya pele, mme ba khanna motse ka di-gigs tse tsebang haholo. Empa ke ne ke se na t≈°ekamelo ea molao, esita le thutong ena e fokolang ea abstruse ea eona, eo lelapa la ka le e amohetseng. Ha e le navy, e ne e feshene ka lehlakoreng la eona, empa ke ne ke tsofetse haholo ha taba e ne e qala ho e kenya hape, ka bolelele, kaha ho ne ho se na tlhoko ea ho ba le mosebetsi ofe kapa ofe ho hang, joalo ka ha ke ne ke le dashing le theko e theko e boima ntle le seaparo se khubelu mokokotlong oa ka joalo ka ha ke le mong,  Ho se sebetse ho ne ho boleloa ka botlalo hore e be molemo ka ho fetisisa le ea hlomphehang, 'me mohlankana ea lilemo li leshome le metso e robeli ha aa ka akaretsoa ka tieo ho ba maphathaphathe ho hanela kopo ea metsoalle ea hae hore a se ke a etsa letho. Ka lebaka leo, ke ile ka kena Oxford 'me esale ke sa sebetse ho tloha ka nako eo. "

tn: A araba a re: "Ke a go tshepisa gore ke kgale ke akantse ka ntlha e, jaaka o akanya jaanong. E ne e le ka dinako tsotlhe, e bile go ka direga gore ka metlha ke tla nna le bothata jo bo masisi mo go nna, gore ga ke ise ke nne le kgwebo e e tlhokegang go nna le seabe mo go nna, ga ke na tiro epe e ke ka e dirang, kgotsa e ka nna ya nthusa. Mme ka maswabi, le ditsala tsa me tse di nkgatlhang, di dirile gore ke se ka ka nna le boithamako, ke se na thuso. Ga re kitla re kgona go dumalana le tshwetso ya rona ya go rera. Ke ne ka simolola go dira kereke, fela jaaka ke ne ke sa ntse ke dira. Le fa go ntse jalo, seo se ne se sa lekana go thusa lelapa la me. en: "I have just had the honour of receiving your letter, for which I beg to return my sincere acknowledgments. I am much concerned to find there was anything in my behaviour last night that did not meet your approbation; and though I am quite at a loss to discover in what point I could be so unfortunate as to offend you, I entreat your forgiveness of what I can assure you to have been perfectly unintentional. I shall never reflect on my former acquaintance with your family in Devonshire without the most grateful pleasure, and flatter myself it will not be broken by any mistake or misapprehension of my actions. My esteem for your whole family is very sincere; but if I have been so unfortunate as to give rise to a belief of more than I felt, or meant to express, I shall reproach myself for not having been more guarded in my professions of that esteem. That I should ever have meant more you will allow to be impossible, when you understand that my affections have been long engaged elsewhere, and it will not be many weeks, I believe, before this engagement is fulfilled. It is with great regret that I obey your commands in returning the letters with which I have been honoured from you, and the lock of hair, which you so obligingly bestowed on me.

es: Acabo de tener el honor de recibir su carta, por la cual le ruego aceptar mis m√°s sinceros agradecimientos. Me preocupa enormemente saber que algo en mi comportamiento de anoche no contara con su aprobaci√≥n; y aunque me siento incapaz de descubrir en qu√© pude ser tan desafortunado como para ofenderla, le suplico me perdone lo que puedo asegurarle fue enteramente involuntario. Nunca recordar√© mi relaci√≥n con su familia en Devonshire sin el placer y reconocimiento m√°s profundos, y quisiera pensar que no la romper√° ning√∫n error o mala interpretaci√≥n de mis acciones. Estimo muy sinceramente a toda su familia; pero si he sido tan desafortunado como para dar pie a que mis sentimientos se creyeran mayores de lo que son o de lo que quise expresar, mucho me recriminar√© por no haber sido m√°s cuidadoso en las manifestaciones de esa estima. Que alguna vez haya querido decir m√°s, aceptar√° que es imposible cuando sepa que mis afectos han estado comprometidos desde hace mucho en otra parte, y no transcurrir√°n muchas semanas, creo, antes de que se cumpla este compromiso. Es con gran pesar que obedezco su orden de devolverle las cartas con que me ha honrado, y el mech√≥n de sus cabellos que tan graciosamente me concedi√≥.

Ke ne ke t≈°oenyehile haholo ka ho fumana ho na le ho hong boit≈°oarong ba ka bosiung bo fetileng bo sa kang ba kopana le approbation ea hau; Le ha ho le jwalo, ha ke ne ke sa tsebe hore na ke tla etsa jwang hore o se ke wa etsa sebe, ke tla o tshwarela ka ho sa feleng. Ha ho mohla nke keng ka nahanisisa ka eo ke neng ke tloaetse le ba lelapa la hau Devonshire ntle le thabo e lebohang ka ho fetesisa, 'me ka bonna e ke ke ea robeha ke phoso kapa ho khelosoa ha liketso tsa ka.  ªO ka ho ªoku ªi a me ka ho ªoku ªi; Empa haeba ke 'nile ka ba joalo e le ho fana ka tumelo ea ho feta kamoo ke neng ke ikutloa kateng, kapa ho ne ho reretsoe ho hlahisa, Ke tla nyeka ka lebaka la hore ha ke e-s'o lebela mesebetsing ea ka ea boitlhompho bona. Hore ke ne ke tla be ke bolela tse ling u tla lumella ho se khonehe, ha u utloisisa hore lerato la ka le sebelitse nako e telele libakeng tse ling, 'me e ke ke ea e-ba libeke tse ngata, kea lumela, pele boitlamo bona bo phethahala. Ke masoabi haholo hore ke mamela litaelo tsa hao ka ho khutlisa mangolo ao ke 'nileng a tlotlisoa ho uena, le notletsoe ea moriri, eo u tlamehang ho mpha eona.

tn: "Ke ne ke sa tswa go amogela lekwalo la gago, le ke le kopang gore ke busetse se ke se amogetseng. Ke ne ke tshwenyegile thata fa ke ne ke le mo dingwageng tsa bosheng jaana tse ke neng ke sa di bone mo botshelong jwa me; Le fa go ntse jalo, le fa ke ne ke sa kgone go dira dilo tse di sa siamang, ke ne ke tla go thusa gore o se ka wa tshwenyega thata ka dilo tse ke neng ke di tlhoka go di dira. Ga nkitla ke tlhola ke akanya ka ga ditsala tsa me tse di neng di le mo tseleng e ke neng ke e dira ka yone, ke ne ke sa batle go dira dilo tse di sa siamang tse di neng di le mo tseleng e ke neng ke na le yone e bile ga ke na go dira dilo tse di sa siamang. 21Gonne losika lwa me lo a ikanyega; Mme fa e le gore ke ne ke le maswe thata go feta kafa ke neng ke ikutlwa ka gone, kana ke ne ke ikutlwa ke le molato, ke tla itlhoboga ka ntlha ya gore ga ke ise ke lebege mo ditirong tsa me tsa boitlhamedi. Le fa go ntse jalo, ke ne ke akanya gore ke tla bo ke sa tlhole ke kgona go dira dilo tse dintsi, fa o lemoga gore lorato lwa me lo na le lobaka lo loleele, e bile ga lo kitla lo nna dibeke di le dintsi, ke a dumela gore, pele ga go dira jalo. 15Ke a ikwatlhaya ka ntlha ya gore ke utlwa ditaolo tsa gago ka go busetsa dikwalo tse ke di amogetseng mo go wena, le thiri e e tswang mo go wena, e bong moriri o o ntiretseng mo go ona.

Tsy hieritreritra velively ny olom-pantatro taloha amin'ny fianakavianao ao Devonshire aho raha tsy misy ny fahafinaretana feno fankasitrahana indrindra, ary ny tenako dia tsy ho tapaka amin'ny fahadisoana na ny tsy firaharahiana ny zavatra ataoko izany. Ny fanajako ny fianakavianareo manontolo dia tena tso-po; fa raha toa aho ka tena mampalahelo tokoa ka naneho finoana mihoatra noho izay tsapako, na natao hanehoana, dia hanala baraka ny tenako aho noho ny tsy nahafahako niaro bebe kokoa ny asako momba izany fanajana izany. Ny hoe tokony ho nanan-danja bebe kokoa aho dia hamela ny ho tsy azo tanterahina ianao, rehefa takatrao fa efa ela no nirotsaka tany an-kafa ny fitiavako ary tsy ho herinandro maromaro izany, araka ny hevitro, alohan'ny hahatanteraka izany fanoloran-tena izany. en: "I cannot express my disappointment in having missed you the day before yesterday, nor my astonishment at not having received any answer to a note which I sent you above a week ago. I have been expecting to hear from you, and still more to see you, every hour of the day. Pray call again as soon as possible, and explain the reason of my having expected this in vain. You had better come earlier another time, because we are generally out by one. We were last night at Lady Middleton's, where there was a dance. I have been told that you were asked to be of the party. But could it be so? You must be very much altered indeed since we parted, if that could be the case, and you not there. But I will not suppose this possible, and I hope very soon to receive your personal assurance of its being otherwise.

en: "It was nearly three years after this unhappy period before I returned to England. My first care, when I DID arrive, was of course to seek for her; but the search was as fruitless as it was melancholy. I could not trace her beyond her first seducer, and there was every reason to fear that she had removed from him only to sink deeper in a life of sin. Her legal allowance was not adequate to her fortune, nor sufficient for her comfortable maintenance, and I learnt from my brother that the power of receiving it had been made over some months before to another person. He imagined, and calmly could he imagine it, that her extravagance, and consequent distress, had obliged her to dispose of it for some immediate relief. At last, however, and after I had been six months in England, I DID find her. Regard for a former servant of my own, who had since fallen into misfortune, carried me to visit him in a spunging‚Äìhouse, where he was confined for debt; and there, in the same house, under a similar confinement, was my unfortunate sister. So altered‚Äîso faded‚Äîworn down by acute suffering of every kind! hardly could I believe the melancholy and sickly figure before me, to be the remains of the lovely, blooming, healthful girl, on whom I had once doted. What I endured in so beholding her‚Äîbut I have no right to wound your feelings by attempting to describe it‚ÄîI have pained you too much already. That she was, to all appearance, in the last stage of a consumption, was‚Äîyes, in such a situation it was my greatest comfort. Life could do nothing for her, beyond giving time for a better preparation for death; and that was given. I saw her placed in comfortable lodgings, and under proper attendants; I visited her every day during the rest of her short life: I was with her in her last moments."

El inter√©s por un antiguo criado que, despu√©s de haber dejado mi servicio, hab√≠a ca√≠do en desgracia, me indujo a visitarlo en un lugar de detenci√≥n donde lo hab√≠an recluido por deudas; y all√≠, en el mismo lugar, en igual reclusi√≥n, se encontraba mi infortunada hermana. ¬°Tan cambiada, tan deslucida, desgastada por todo tipo de sufrimientos! A duras penas pod√≠a creer que la triste y enferma figura que ten√≠a frente a m√≠ fuera lo que quedaba de la adorable, floreciente, saludable-muchacha de quien alguna vez hab√≠a estado prendado. Ha ke fihla, ke ne ke batla ho mo batla; Empa ho batla ho ne ho se na litholoana joalokaha e ne e le melancholy. Ke ne ke sitoa trace hae ka nƒ£'ane ho seducer hae pele, 'me ho na le lebaka le leng le le leng la ho t≈°aba hore o ile a tlosoa ho eena feela ho teba bophelong ba sebe. Ha ke na bonnete ba hore o ne a sa tsebe hore na ke mang ea nang le tsebo ea hae ea ho ba le bophelo bo botle, empa ke ile ka ithuta ho motsoalle oa ka hore o ne a se a ntse a e-na le nako e fetang likhoeli tse 'maloa pele ho moo. O ne a ka nahana hore o ne a ka inahanela hore o ne a ka ikoahlaela, mme ka hona, o ne a mo qobella hore a ilo phomola ka potlako. Qetellong, 'me ka mor'a likhoeli tse t≈°eletseng ke ile ka mo fumana.  ªO ka ho ªohehe ªe  ªana i ka ho ªona ªi; 'Me moo, ka tlung e le' ngoe, tlas'a th≈çko e t≈°oanang, e ne e le khaitseli ea ka e bohloko.  ªO ka  ªae  ªana o ka  ªa ªae  ªana o ka  ªae  ªana a me ka ho ªokolo ªana a me ka ho ªoha ªana i Ke ne ke sa khone ho lumela hore mencholy le set≈°oant≈°o se kulang ka pel'a ka, ho ba mesaletsa ea ngoanana ea monate, ea phetseng hantle, ea phetseng hantle, eo ke kileng ka mo mamela. Ke ne ke sa tsebe hore na ke mang ea nang le maikutlo a hau ka ho fetesisa, empa ha ke na tokelo ea ho u fa maikutlo a hau ka ho leka ho u hlalosetsa hore na ke u file phoso e kholo hakae. O ile a re e ne e le ka nako e le 'ngoe ea ho qetela, e ne e le ka mokhoa o ts'oanang, e ne e le ntho e ntle ka ho fetisisa eo ke neng ke e-na le eona. Bophelo bo ke ke ba mo etsetsa letho, ho feta ho fana ka nako ea ho itokisetsa lefu le betere; 'Me seo se ile sa fuoa. Ke ile ka mo bona a le sebakeng se setle sa bolulo le ka tlas'a bahlanka ba hae; Ke ne ke mo etela letsatsi le leng le le leng nakong ea bophelo ba hae bo khut≈°oanyane: Ke ne ke le eena linakong tsa hae tsa ho qetela. tn: "E ne e le dingwaga di ka nna tharo morago ga nako eno e e sa itumediseng pele ga ke boela kwa Engelane. Tlhokomelo ya me ya ntlha, fa ke ne ke goroga, e ne e le go mmatla; mme go batla go ne go sena maungo fela jaaka go ne go le kutlobotlhoko. Ke ne ke sa kgone go mo latedisa go feta mohepi wa gagwe wa ntlha, mme go ne go na le lebaka le le utlwalang la go boifa gore o ne a tlositse mo go ene fela gore a nwelele kwa teng mo botshelong jwa boleo Tetla ya gagwe ya semolao e ne e se. e e lekaneng khumo ya gagwe, le fa e le e e lekaneng go mo tlhokomela ka phuthologo, mme ke ne ka ithuta mo go morwarre gore maatla a go e amogela a ne a dirilwe mo dikgweding dingwe pele ga foo go motho yo mongwe O ne a akanya, mme ka tidimalo o ne a kgona go e akanya, gore go tlhoka maitseo ga gagwe, le. go tshwenyega go go neng ga nna teng ka ntlha ya seo, go ne go mo pateleditse go e latlha gore a bone thuso nngwe ka bonako Le fa go ntse jalo, kgabagare, le morago ga gore ke e dirise. ke ne ke na le dikgwedi di le thataro kwa Engelane, KE NE ka mo fitlhela Go tlotla motlhanka wa me wa pele, yo o neng a sale a wela mo matlhotlhapelo, a ntshotse go mo etela mo ntlong ya go tlhotlhora, kwa a neng a tswaletswe gone ka ntlha ya dikoloto; ntlo e le nngwe, ka fa tlase ga kgolegelo e e tshwanang, e ne e le kgaitsadiake yo o sa itumelang. E fetotswe thata‚Äîe nyeletse thata‚Äîe lapisitswe ke pogo e e botlhoko ya mofuta mongwe le mongwe! ke ne ke sa dumele gore setshwantsho se se hutsafetseng le se se lwalang se se neng se le fa pele ga me, ke masalela a mosetsana yo o rategang, yo o thunyang, yo o itekanetseng, yo ke kileng ka mo rata thata. Se ke neng ka se itshokela ka go mmona jalo‚Äîmme ga ke na tshwanelo ya go go gobatsa maikutlo ka go leka go se tlhalosa‚Äîke setse ke go utlwisitse botlhoko thata. Gore o ne a le, go ya ka ponagalo yotlhe, mo kgatong ya bofelo ya go ja, e ne e le‚Äîee, mo seemong se se ntseng jalo e ne e le kgomotso ya me e kgolo. Botshelo bo ne bo ka se mo direle sepe, kwa ntle ga go mo naya nako ya go ipaakanyetsa loso botoka; mme seo sa newa. Ke ne ka mmona a beilwe mo mafelong a bonno a a manobonobo, le ka fa tlase ga batlhokomedi ba ba tshwanetseng; Ke ne ke mo etela letsatsi le letsatsi mo botshelong jotlhe jwa gagwe jo bokhutshwane: Ke ne ke na le ene mo dinakong tsa gagwe tsa bofelo."

tn: "Ga ke itse," a bua jalo, a re: "Ga ke itse gore o ka nna wa akanya ka ga gagwe, o ka nna wa akanya gore o ka bo o le molato wa ga kgaitsadio, kgotsa gore o tla utlwa sengwe le sengwe se se ka mo diragalelang. Fa ke ne ke le mo lapeng la me, ke ne ke se na maikaelelo a mangwe, ga ke na mogopolo o mongwe fela wa go dira gore ke nne le nako e e itumedisang fa ke ne ke patelesega go nna kwa Devonshire, go le monate go feta pele. Ke ne ke sa kgone go dira dilo tse di molemo le tse di molemo tse di ka se go itumediseng, mme ke ne ke sa kgone go dira jalo. Ke ne ke le pelo ya me e e nkgatlhang, ke ne ke sa akanye gore ke eng se se neng se direga le gore ke ne ke le pelo ya me e e neng e sa amogelesege! Mme kwa tshimologong ke tshwanetse go ipolela, lefela la me le ne le phatsimetswe ke lone. Ke ne ka akanya fela ka boitumelo jwa me, go nna le maikutlo a ke neng ke le mo go one ka dinako tsotlhe, ke ne ka leka go dira gore ke itumele mo go ene, go se na tsela e ke ikutlwang ka yone.

en: How soon he had walked himself into the proper resolution, however, how soon an opportunity of exercising it occurred, in what manner he expressed himself, and how he was received, need not be particularly told. This only need be said;‚Äîthat when they all sat down to table at four o'clock, about three hours after his arrival, he had secured his lady, engaged her mother's consent, and was not only in the rapturous profession of the lover, but, in the reality of reason and truth, one of the happiest of men. His situation indeed was more than commonly joyful. He had more than the ordinary triumph of accepted love to swell his heart, and raise his spirits. He was released without any reproach to himself, from an entanglement which had long formed his misery, from a woman whom he had long ceased to love;‚Äîand elevated at once to that security with another, which he must have thought of almost with despair, as soon as he had learnt to consider it with desire. He was brought, not from doubt or suspense, but from misery to happiness;‚Äîand the change was openly spoken in such a genuine, flowing, grateful cheerfulness, as his friends had never witnessed in him before.

es: No es necesario, sin embargo, contar en detalle lo que tard√≥ su caminata en llevarlo a tomar la decisi√≥n adecuada, cu√°nto demor√≥ en presentarse la oportunidad de ponerla en pr√°ctica, de qu√© manera se expres√≥ y c√≥mo fue recibido. Lo √∫nico que importa decir es esto: que cuando todos se sentaron a la mesa a las cuatro, alrededor de tres horas despu√©s de su llegada, hab√≠a conseguido a su dama, hab√≠a logrado el consentimiento de la madre, y era el m√°s feliz de los hombres. Y ello no s√≥lo en el embelesado discurso del enamorado, sino en la realidad de la raz√≥n y la verdad. Ciertamente su dicha era m√°s que la com√∫n. Un triunfo mayor que el corriente en los amores correspondidos le hench√≠a el coraz√≥n y le elevaba el esp√≠ritu. Se hab√≠a liberado, sin culpa alguna de su parte, de ataduras que por largo tiempo lo hab√≠an hecho infeliz y lo hab√≠an mantenido unido a una mujer a quien hac√≠a mucho hab√≠a dejado de amar; y, de inmediato, hab√≠a alcanzado en otra mujer esa seguridad por la que debi√≥ desesperar desde el mismo momento en que la hab√≠a empezado a desear. Hab√≠a transitado no desde la duda o el suspenso, sino desde la desdicha a la felicidad; y habl√≥ del cambio abiertamente con una alegr√≠a tan genuina, f√°cil y reconfortante como nunca le hab√≠an conocido antes sus amigas.

st: Leha ho le joalo, kapele hakae o ile a tsamaea ka qeto e nepahetseng, leha ho le joalo, kapele hakae monyetla oa ho e sebelisa e etsahetse, ka tsela efe eo a itlhalosang ka eona, le kamoo a ileng a amoheloa kateng, ha ho hlokahale hore a boleloe ka ho khetheha. Sena se lokela ho boleloa feela; hore ha bohle ba lula tafoleng ka hora ea boraro, hoo e ka bang lihora tse tharo ka mor'a ho fihla ha hae, o ne a secured mofumahali oa hae, o ile a kopanela tumello ea 'm√® oa hae, 'me e ne e se feela mosebetsing oa rapturous oa moratuoa, empa, ka 'nete ea lebaka le' nete, e mong oa thabileng ka ho fetisisa ea banna. Ha e le hantle, boemo ba hae bo ne bo le monate ho feta kamoo a neng a lula a thabile ka teng. O ne a e-na le tlholo e tloaelehileng ea lerato le amohelehang ho ruruha pelo ea hae, le ho phahamisa meea ea hae. O ile a lokolloa ka ntle ho nyeliso leha e le efe ho eena, ho tsoa ho t≈°oeroeng e neng e sa tsoa thehoa mahlomola a hae nako e telele, ho mosali eo a neng a khale a khaotsa ho ratana; hape a phahamisoa hang-hang ho t≈°ireletseho eo le e mong, eo a tlamehang ho nahana ka hoo e ka bang ka ho nyahama, hang-hang ha a ne a ithutile ho e nahana ka takatso. O ile a tlisoa, eseng ho pelaelo kapa suspense, empa ho tloha ho masisa-pelo ho ea thabong ho isa thabong; 'me u tsebe hore na phetoho e ne e builoe pepeneneng ka 'nete, e phallang, thabo ea teboho, joalo ka ha metsoalle ea hae e ne e se e kile ea paka ho eena pele.

tn: Le fa go ntse jalo, o ne a nna le nako e e kana kang fa a neng a akanya ka teng, mme o ne a sa tlhoke go bolelelwa sepe ka tsela e e utlwalang sentle. A re fa a sena go tsena mo ntlong ya gagwe ka ura ya boraro, o ne a setse a na le mosadi wa gagwe, mme e ne e se fela ka nako ya fa a ne a le mo ntlong ya gagwe, mme e ne e le mongwe wa batho ba ba itumetseng thata, mme e le mongwe wa batho ba ba itumetseng thata. Tota e bile, botshelo jwa gagwe bo ne bo feta boitumelo jwa mmatota. O ne a na le maatla a a fetang a a tlwaelegileng a go amogela lorato lwa go ruruga pelo ya gagwe le go tsosa meya ya gagwe. O ne a gololwa a se na nyatsego epe, go tloga mo kgaseng e e sa bolong go bopa pogisego ya gagwe, go tswa mo mosading yo a neng a sa bolo go mo tlogela go ratana; mme a phasaladiwa ka bonako mo tshireletsong eo le yo mongwe, e a neng a tshwanetse go akanya ka yone ka go tlhoka tshepo eo, ka bonako fela fa a ne a ithutile go e sekaseka ka keletso. O ne a isiwa, e seng go belaela, mme go tswa mo bohutsaneng go ya kwa boitumelong go ya kwa go ene; le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go buiwa ka tsela e e utlwalang sentle mo go ene, e leng boitumelo jo bo ntseng jalo, bopelontle jwa tebogo, jaaka ditsala tsa gagwe di ne di ise di ke di bone mo go ene pele.
